condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities
No. of UNICEF field offices with health staff trained in gap analysis, block monitoring and use of data for decision making/planning (Revised indicator No. 1 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:'100 per cent health field staff have received an orientation on the district gap analysis of key pillars of CTA (RI, Newborn Care and Quality Maternal Health) during the network meeting. title.narrative: Proportion of district monitors from UNICEF supported HPDs trained on analysis of data from gap analysis and block monitoring and its effective use for influencing planning (Revised indicator No. 2 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:'100 percent: All district monitors who are currently in position have received informal orientation on analysis of data from gap analysis and block monitoring. District orientation sessions have been conducted.

title.narrative: No. of National/ Regional/ State level reviews and field visits conducted jointly with Government counterparts on RMNCH +A strategy implementation (Revised indicator No. 4 in June 2014)

actual.value:
2015:'15 out of 15 states:
National: - Regular CTA review meetings. Joint meeting organized by GoI, UNICEF and state officials in preparation for IDCF. - NPCC meetings discussed the state's PIPs with UNICEF participation.

title.narrative: No. of UNICEF supported CTA states having established partnership mechanisms with academic institutions /medical colleges / professional bodies for capacity building, supportive supervision and block monitoring (Revised indicator No. 3 in June 2014)

actual.value: 2015:'15 out of 15 states: All field offices have established a robust partnership mechanism along with the medical colleges, nursing colleges and other professional bodies like IAP, SOMI for capacity building, supportive supervision and block monitoring in HPDs.
